label: 元杲
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Gengō (J.) 元杲, also called 延命院僧都、真言房 Enmei'in sōzu, Shingon-bō. Monk of Daigoji Enmei'in known for his success in use of the 請雨経法 shōugyō hō esoteric rain-prayer ritual at Shinzen'en imperial garden, and the teacher of illustrious clerics such as Ningai and Chōnen. Gengō, who was also known for his knowledge of esoteric Nyoirin Kannon and consecration, received denbō kanjō from the Ishiyamadera monk Shunny・in 949, rose to positions such as first abbot of Tōji, naigu praying on behalf of the imperial family, and chief administrator (hōmu).
